alert.note: Alert for Harrison (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 20 at 2:29PM CDT until June 20 at 5:30PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR WESTERN HARRISON COUNTY... At 229 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen with the highest amounts observed along and north of I-10. Rainfall rates will be much lighter through 4 PM CDT as the earlier thunderstorms has moved off the coast. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. However, runoff from the earlier heavy rain will extend the flash flooding. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Gulfport, Biloxi, Long Beach, Lyman, Saucier and Gulfport Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 22 and 38. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
